title: 103_hr2082
content: The Act titled "NDRF Ship Disposal Act of 1993" authorizes the disposal of National Defense Reserve Fleet vessels. The NDRF Ship Disposal Act of 1993 mandates the Secretary of Transportation to dispose of vessels in the National Defense Reserve Fleet by January 1, 1999, that are not assigned to the Ready Reserve Force or required for a specific purpose. Notification to the Secretary of the Navy is required 90 days before disposal. The Secretary must not dispose of a vessel if the Secretary of the Navy certifies within 30 days that it is militarily useful and necessary for national defense. The Secretary can also retain a vessel if needed by a State or Federal agency, with certification to Congress. The Secretary may dispose of a vessel after one year unless the Secretary of the Navy certifies its military usefulness within 30 days. Vessels can also be retained if needed by a State or Federal agency with certification to Congress. The Secretary may dispose of a vessel unless a subsequent certification is made under subparagraph (B). This section does not supersede the Endangered Species Act. Vessels shall be disposed of in accordance with specific methods outlined in the Merchant Marine Act, 1936. The Secretary must submit a plan for vessel disposal to Congress within 3 months of this section's effective date. The plan should include procedures for notifying the Secretary of the Navy and standards for identifying vessels to be disposed of. The Secretary must submit a plan for vessel disposal to Congress within 3 months of this section's effective date, including procedures for identifying vessels to be disposed of, establishing priorities for disposal, making certifications, developing standards, and creating a preliminary schedule for vessel disposals. Additionally, the Secretary may select up to 15 vessels for the Artificial Reef Program. The Secretary may select up to 15 vessels for use as offshore artificial reefs, in accordance with the Act. The Secretary shall transfer the identified vessels to States fulfilling the transfer requirements under the Act. The National Defense Reserve Fleet refers to the fleet maintained under the Merchant Ship Sales Act of 1946. Section 11 of the Merchant Ship Sales Act of 1946 defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of Transportation and specifies that this section will be effective starting January 1, 1994.
